questions.question:
Refer Fig. 1 to answer the following questions.


Fig. 1. Circuit configuration of push-pull converter.


1. The voltage stress of the switches (Q1 and Q2) is:
2. During dead time, the status of the switches (Q<sub>1</sub> and Q<sub>2</sub>) and the diodes (Di<sub>1</sub>, Di<sub>2</sub>) are :

answers.a: Q<sub>1</sub> -OFF, Q<sub>2</sub> – ON, Di<sub>1</sub> – OFF, Di<sub>2</sub> - ON
answers.b: Q<sub>1</sub> -ON, Q<sub>2</sub> – OFF, Di<sub>1</sub> – ON, Di<sub>2</sub> - OFF
answers.c: Q<sub>1</sub> -ON, Q<sub>2</sub> – ON, Di<sub>1</sub> – OFF, Di<sub>2</sub> - OFF
answers.d: Q<sub>1</sub> -OFF, Q<sub>2</sub> – OFF, Di<sub>1</sub> – ON, Di<sub>2</sub> - ON

questions.question: 3. A push-pull converter is delivering an output power of 2 kW at an efficiency of 95%. Calculate the total losses (P<sub>Loss</sub>) occurring in the converter.
4. The inductor ripple current expression is
5. What is the voltage across the switches (Q<sub>1</sub> and Q<sub>2</sub>) when both the diodes (Di<sub>1</sub>, Di<sub>2</sub>) are conducting?
